alert.note: Alert for Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 7:40AM EST until January 14 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Chatham affecting Morris and Somerset Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Passaic River at Chatham. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Open areas adjacent to the Passaic River flood in New Providence, Chatham Township, and Berkley Heights. At 6.0 feet, Portions of the Shepard Kolluck Park in Chatham floods. River Road by Henry Drive is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM EST Sunday was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 01/27/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Passaic River Chatham 6.0 6.0 Sun 7 am 5.7 5.4 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1045 AM EST.
